name: Headley Heath Butterfly Walk, Box Hill

ai.summary: A 7.7 km moderate hike around Headley Heath near Box Hill, offering open chalk grassland, heathland scenery and potential butterfly sightings. The loop follows well-maintained paths with gentle ascents and some rocky or uneven sections, suitable for hikers with steady footwear and a reasonable level of fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained chalk paths across heathland with sections of compact gravel and occasional steps. Expect uneven surfaces, a few short climbs, and some muddy patches after rain. Parts of the route traverse open exposed heath, so sun and wind can be noticeable.
ai.safety_notes: Carry a map or GPS, tell someone your plan, and be prepared for changes in weather. Heathland can be exposed, so bring sun protection and plenty of water. Watch for ticks in long grass, wear long trousers in tick season, and stay to marked paths. Mobile reception may be patchy in remote sections; carry a whistle and know a fallback route.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Lightweight rain cover or dry bag for gear
ai.best_seasons: Spring to early autumn; peak butterfly season May–August.

seo.title: Headley Heath Butterfly Walk – Box Hill (UK) 7.7 km Moderate Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Headley Heath Butterfly Walk at Box Hill, a 7.7 km moderate hike across chalk grassland in Surrey. Ideal for butterfly enthusiasts from spring to late summer.
seo.h1: Headley Heath Butterfly Walk – Box Hill, UK | 7.7 km Moderate Hike
